name: Hotel on Rivington

reviews.title: Very Cool for School
reviews.text: The only negative I would have for the Rivington is its location. A definite cab ride from the main attractions, on arrival after basically a day of travelling the hotel is anything but welcoming.

However, do not let that put you off. This place is ice cool, and surrounds with you every comfort to ensure you have an enjoyable stay. The piece de resistance is the view, the glass frontage providing some dramatic windows to the Manhattan skyline. We were upgraded to a suite for our first wedding anniversary, and I have rarely had a better night's sleep on the super-comfy bed.
reviews.title: Enjoyable but location-challenged

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was good, but not spectacular, although our general experience of NY courtesy was surprisingly disappointing, so the Rivington's service levels were above average in comparison.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: If you are looking for a safe chain hotel in the heart of the city the Rivington is definitely not for you. However, if you're after something a little different and cutting edge, give the Rivington a go.
reviews.title: More Hype Than Hip

reviews.text: We joined our teenage daughter on a expense paid trip to NYC for a modeling shoot and her agency selected and paid $375 a night for a standard room, Rm. 85. We stayed 2 nights. The hotel is indeed an oasis in the lower east side neighborhood. The service staff, bellmen, food servers are outstanding -- they give Four Seasons kind of attention and make this place a wonderful stay. We moved to the Waldorf Astoria for the weekend and would have loved to see this kind of service. We ate dinner both nights in the hotel (because the neighborhood was intimidating to us at night). Pork chops, steak, fish and drinks were very good. The decor and the rooms are upbeat and stylish. The beds were great. No complaints from us.
reviews.title: Disappointing and credit card busting!

likes.liked: — the neighbourhood , the bed and the design
likes.disliked: — style over substance and too expensive for what is on offer

reviews.text: I was intrigued by the hotel when I was looking for somewhere new and interesting to stay in NY in October. Although the hotel is not in the most convenient neighborhood, I still gave it a try to check out the rooms and decor.
reviews.title: Send your staff to customer service school

reviews.text: The staff at check-in and at the front door were nice, although clearly not very experienced. My room had some very interesting features (heated floors), electric shades. For being only open a few months, however, the decor was already showing quite a bit of wear - dirty and worn carpets, scratched floor in the elevator, worn drapes, etc.
reviews.title: Just Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked a saturday night at Hotel on Rivington and we loved it. From the unconventional layout, to the glass curtain walling, to the voyeuristic shower walls, everything about this place screams hedonistic pleasure. The service was prompt, the staff were friendly. But the real joy is in the rooms itself. We booked the lowest rate ($255) so we were not too high up (7th). However we got a corner room which is entirely glassed on two sides, had a balcony and gives you an amazing feeling of being out in the open. Granted we were on the inside space but we were high enough that the view wasn't totally obstructed and we could see the Williamsburg bridge in the distance. The bed is one of the best beds I've slept in. The shower and bathroom are very modern, although my wife was embarassed at using the shower because some of the windows aren't frosted so anyone looking up can totally see you if they're paying attention. Maybe thats part of the reason that people want to stay here: watch and be watched. You shouldn't be entirely surprised that the hotels cash bar also includes a sex games book, vibrator and binoculars! Suffice to say, my wife and I had a very satisfying weekend. Its not a Marriott or businessman/tourist trap by any means. Its for the traveler or couple that's looking for a truly unique stay in Manhattan. The lounge downstairs is very chic bumping at night, so you don't have to go far to have fun. Given the location, all of Soho and the village are in close proximity. We even got street parking since we got there in the afternoon on saturday. Breakfast is included which is an added bonus.
reviews.title: Unique location for a hotel, Extremely Modern, Very Sexy

likes.disliked: — Immediate surroundings in lower east side are gritty

reviews.title: Loved this hotel, it's my New York home away from home!
reviews.text: It took us ages to decide on a hotel for our recent trip to New York, but I'm so glad we made our choice with the Rivington. Based in the Lower East Side, you couldn't get much hipper. everything, and i mean everything you could need is on your doorstep-bars, resturants you name it. It was such a major effort not be lazy and wander to yet another fabulous little abode for our evenings entertainment. On arrival we did have a slight quibble as there was no doorman and the reception area isn't immediately obvious(it's on the 2nd floor). However this was instantly dismissed when we were greeted by very friendly and helpful reception staff. Our room...well it was amazing. If you like contemporary furnishings , and neutral tones , with amazing views then this place is for you. If you like , more traditional/or floral decor then this will not work for you. The bathroom was a delight-views from the bath can't be missed looking out over the city , you just can't beat it. Oh and did i say the tub is definitely big enough for two.The tempur bed makes every nights sleep dreamy...There was nothing wrong with our room in the slightest , however our neighbour smoked and we could smell this in our bathroom.Not being smokers it made us feel a bit sick .After a quick chat with the reception staff they moved us (i mean literally ) to another room without a quibble to another room with amazing views of city up and downtown.A free breakfast included in the price, nothing fancy . However if you want to push the boat out the food in the hotel is AMAZING! And if your lucky enough to be there over the weekend then maybe you'll be served by Giles the lovely waiter. That said , i found the level of service not on the same level as that in the hotel.I felt that some of the waiting staff were more concerned with networking than the job they were being paid to do.If you're feeling tired though, the hotel bar is the place to be, the music rocks, the cocktails rock and thre is a really eclectic crowd to observe.Oh i forgot to mention free internet use if you haven't remembered your laptop. And just because they were so lovely the reception staff really do get a huge thumbs up, no question was too inane and they were full of advice, tips and helpful information.We won't be staying anywhere else. The Rivington is the bomb!!

The hotel is pretty, I stayed at room 146, the view was just amazing, but the service sucked!!! They say that you have free breakfast that is...croissant, bagel and coffee, if you want anything else you have to pay for. Also they include 20% tip on everything, and room service has a delivery fee of $2, not much, but a joke after they have already charged you 20% tip. A glass of red wine and a plate of pasta cost me $50 (room service) with all this extra charges. They overcharged my room for 3 things that I am still trying to find out what it is? It has been 2 weeks now, so I called my AX card. The accounting guy sends me an email after I emailed him 3 times, and called 5 times...so be careful. The manager should take some courses on hotel management, as he is so lost on what 'service' means. Like I said, the hotel is pretty, but the service is abominable!!!
reviews.title: Trendy Hotel Horrible Service

likes.disliked: — It was so cold in the room. I stayed for 3 nights, and they never vacummed the floor...gross...

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: I´m a travel agent and I travel quit often. For my surprise I went to to Hotel on Rivington as a friend indication, and he coundt have been more right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is amazing in a quiet and trendy neigbohood. The staff were impeccable, I felt like a princess.
reviews.title: BEST of the trendy boutique-like hotels! Luxury

reviews.text: This hotel is over priced for what you get. I travel to NYC quite often and thought I would treat myself to a nicer hotel this time around. The Rivington was advertised as a boutique style hotel and the room was about $350 a night.
reviews.title: Rivington Rip Off
Hotel Nirvana
reviews.text: When I arrived, it took a long time to get my room. The elevator was so small, and the lobby was nothing special - I started to worry when I got off on my floor and the smell was overwhelming. The whole area had a gassy smell. Disgusting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small, and the decor very tired. Sure, it had a duvet on the bed, but big deal. The furniture is old, the quality of the wood bad, and the room small. Very small.
reviews.title: Best stay ever in NY -- In love with the Lower East Side

reviews.text: Imagine my surprise when I open the curtains and am facing a brick wall. Nice. For $350, I want a view.
reviews.title: Great!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I marched donwstairs to ask to be moved to a higher floor - how funny that someone else in front of me in line was complaining about the same things.
reviews.title: Best Hip Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have visited NY many times but have rarely visited the LES. I can now say it is one of the more interesting areas of NY. Its refreshing after long days around the Central Park/ Times Square area. The hotel stands out among the other buildings in the neighborhood but it really works. The staff if very welcoming and the design in the entrance-area nice. The bar/restaurant design is also nice but I have seen more interesting in other ny hotels like the mercer, gansevoort. Food at Thor for breakfast is good but overpriced. You get a free breakfast too but this is just muffins, coffee, etc. What really stands out about this hotel is the rooms. I was on the front of the 10th floor and wow what an awesome view of the ny skyline. I love the floor to ceiling windows. The tempur-pedic mattress was heaven, as was the shower pressure. I love how you can take a shower (it was actually double headed) and look out at the city. We were there on fri-sat and the bar was extremely busy both nights. We avoided it - it was too packed for its own good. Also, they play the music louder than the sound systems can really handle. Overall staff and clientele is pretty attractive. Many Europeans staying here. Would definately stay here again for the room.
reviews.title: Great Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at the hotel after staying 2 nights in midtown. As it was our first time to NY we were a little worried about the area when we arrived at Rivington street. However our worries soon disappeared when we got to know LES and our way around. Its a great place and much nicer and more interetsing than the touristy areas.
reviews.title: great hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was really really nice. The view was amazing - we were on the 16th floor and having the little balcony was so nice.
reviews.title: East Coast Standard Hotel

reviews.text: The room itself is so big and furished really modern just what you expect. The bed linen was gorgeous (frette - so it should be!) And the little touches on the room are great. The bathroom was my favourite (lovely yellow mosaic tiles!) The ren products in the bathroom were brilliant also. The only thing I would say about the room is it needs a little attention as the carpets, paintwork and overall finish looks a little worn and tired and when you are spending $400 + a night you expect things like this to be perfect.
reviews.title: Tries too hard to be FAB but pretty good overall

likes.disliked: — shoddy construction, paper thin walls, tries too hard

reviews.text: The breakfast was ok , nice fresh coffee and pastries BUT I was not happy at being charged £6 for a small glass of orange juice. Ridiculous!!!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

reviews.text: First, let me say I would most definitely choose the hotel on Rivington the next time I'm in New York, and second, let me say the hotel has some major kinks to work out, mostly in staff training. The staff we dealt with were uniformly nice and tried to help, but the hotel seems pervaded by a sort of cluelessness (many of the other reviews have noted this). Favorite example: while checking out, the woman at the counter kept me waiting a few minutes while she dealt with a customer complaining about food-poisoning from the room-service breakfast, and then chatted with her colleagues about what to tell him... really not something to do in front of another client! (We also ordered room service and had no problems.) All this is really vastly outweighed by the hotel's many charms. The vews of New York through the full-wall windows are just unbeatable, and the Rivington has the benefit of being the only tall building in the area (something you can't get in midtown, no matter what the price). The curtains and shades retract at the press of a bedside button. The beds are top-notch though a little strange (tempur-pedic memory foam). The bathroom products are excellent. Free WiFi that works seamlessly. Great minibar. Very reasonable rates. The neighborhood is my new New York favorite, close to all of downtown (SoHo, East Village, Tribeca) with a real culinary renaissance going on right now, lots of exciting new restaurants and clubs within a few blocks. It's still a little rough, so wouldn't be ideal for people scared of urban grit, but we felt very safe walking around even late at night. Once the staff hit their groove, it will be a five-star hotel for sure (and the rates are likely to climb).
reviews.title: Best place to stay in NYC

reviews.text: We spent a long weekend at the Rivington and had a great experience. The service from the doormen to the front desk to the housekeeping and room service staff was polite and attentive.
reviews.title: Great experience in a european style boutique hotel
Okay hotel, bad hood, they can see you too
reviews.text: The hotel is recently finished and is a 21 story glass high-rise with great views above the 8th floor. the decidedly modern design is not for everyone, but our room had a huge soaking tub of which we took full advantage, temperpedic mattress, lots of space for a NYC hotel room to boot. And did I mention clean? Yes! the view was specatcular day and night and i really don't think being viewed is really a problem as there are 2 sets of curtains that close off the view and/or light if you are feeling exposed. We were on the back (south) side ofthe building so it was not a problem at all as we lounged around the room when we were there.

The hotel has a bar/restaurant, THOR, which is a decidedly hipster hangout on the weekends. it can be noisy, but only as you pass by on the way to the elevators. food and drinks are expensive and not the best bargain in the neighborhood. there is a separate lounge and bar on the second floor next to the front desk, and it's only for guests (on weekdays) and very mellow and quiet for the most part.
reviews.title: They took reviews under consideration

reviews.text: Location is right off Houston at Ludlow in the East Village. a bustling, young and vibrant neighborhood at times but NOT scary or unsafe, unless you consider the occassional drunk coed falling off her heels and bumping into you on a late Saturday night dangerous. ;-) lots of little shops and cafes and bars; really a cool and upcoming neighborhood.
reviews.title: Think outside the Ratrace

description: Located in the historic district of the Lower East Side, Hotel on Rivington offers 108 guest rooms and suites. Constructed of floor-to-ceiling glass, most rooms feature 180 degree city views overlooking Midtown Manhattan, the World Trade Center, Brooklyn, Queens and the Williamsburg and Manhattan Bridges. Centrally located in downtown NYC, Hotel on Rivington is walking distance to landmark neighborhoods such as SoHo, Tribeca, Little Italy, Chinatown, the Bowery and the East Village. All guest rooms feature Tempur-Pedic beds, Frette linens, feather duvets and Italian bath amenities by Davines. Guests can select a variety of room features and amenities such as balconies, steam showers and/or Japanese inspired deep-soaking tubs. iPod/iHome stereos, HD televisions, electronic programmable safes and complimentary WiFi are all standard features in the guest rooms. Hotel on Rivington's main restaurant is called CO-OP Food & Drink - a modern American brasserie. Also located in the hotel is - Viktor & Spoils - a nightclub that features live DJ performances on Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights. Additionally, Hotel on Rivington is home to Juice Press. Juice Press serves organic and cold-pressed juices and raw foods catering to Vegetarian and Vegan guests located on the ground floor.
